CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 6, 1966, pg. 6B reads: "Protestant-Catholic Rites - The chancel of St. Richard's Roman catholic [Catholic] Church, Pittsburgh, was the site of an historic scene recently, when Father Donald W. McIlvane, administrator at St. Richard's and Elder Nelson A. Bliss, pastor of Ethan Temple Seventh Day Adventist Church, collaborated in a nuptial ceremony uniting persons of both faiths. The bride is the former Victoria Janice Brown whose mother belongs to the Seventh Day Adventist Church; the groom is Leon Bryan Jr. of Washington, D.C., a member of the Catholic Church.  This communion of the faiths was made possibly by the recent ruling by Pope Paul. (Harris photo)"
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women in wedding party, including bride Victoria Janice Brown Bryan wearing pillbox style headpiece with mid length veil, posed in front of Gothic altar in St. Richard Roman Catholic Church
